intro: Psorospermum afzelii, commonly known as the African firethorn, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces small, red or orange berries that are an important food source for birds and small mammals. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or disturbed habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in some regions.
